snippet.title: Inside The Facebook-WhatsApp Megadeal: The Courtship, The Secret Meetings, The $19 Billion Poker Game
snippet.description: Buying the world’s biggest and most reclusive messaging service took more than just money, but months of gaining its founders' trust and a promise of independence. read »

snippet.title: Alex Rodriguez's 211-Game Suspension Is Death Knell Of A Career Once Destined For Cooperstown
snippet.description: After several months of rumors and speculation, Major League Baseball has officially announced that Alex Rodriguez has been suspended for 211 games due to his use and possession of performance enhancing substances and his attempts to “obstruct and frustrate” the Biogenesis investigation. The suspension will begin on Thursday unless Rodriguez [...] read »

snippet.title: Walt Disney Imagineers Explain How Video Games Influenced New EPCOT Test Track Attraction
snippet.description: VideoLAKE BUENA VISTA, Florida – In a way it’s ironic that EPCOT, which was designed as a world of the future, is one of the most dated theme parks at Walt Disney World Resort. But Disney is working on improving the park. While the Magic Kingdom recently doubled the size [...] read »

snippet.title: While Supreme Court Mulls Ruling on Violent Games, FTC Gives Game Retailers High Scores
snippet.description: A lot can change over the course of a year. Last year, the game industry faced a harsh economy and increased scrutiny as the U.S. Supreme Court decided to formally consider the legality of a California law restricting the sales of violent video games. The industry was hedging its bets [...] read »

snippet.title: The Inside Story Of Snapchat: The World's Hottest App Or A $3 Billion Disappearing Act?
snippet.description: Evan Spiegel, 23, and Bobby Murphy, 25, have turned Snapchat and its disappearing photos into the hottest app in America for teenagers. Hot enough, in fact, to spurn a $3 billion offer from Facebook. Will they become two of the youngest billionaires ever -- or fade quickly into business infamy? read »

snippet.title: Lone Star Stockpicker: The Wit And Wisdom Of Don Hodges
snippet.description: From selling television ads to a 50-year career in the equities business, Don Hodges has long found opportunity in odd places. read »

snippet.title: Arcade Games Make A Comeback
snippet.description: Yes, the Xbox is more high-tech. But a new wave of game players are bringing home something even more special--old-style arcade games. read »
